name: py-jupyter-server-proxy

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
Jupyter Server Proxy lets you run arbitrary external processes (such as
RStudio, Shiny Server, Syncthing, PostgreSQL, Code Server, etc)
alongside your notebook server and provide authenticated web access to
them using a path like /rstudio next to others like /lab.

dependencies.name: py-aiohttp
dependencies.description:
Supports both client and server side of HTTP protocol. Supports both
client and server Web-Sockets out-of-the-box and avoids Callbacks.
Provides Web-server with middlewares and plugable routing.

dependencies.name: py-jupyter-server
dependencies.description:
The Jupyter Server provides the backend (i.e. the core services, APIs,
and REST endpoints) for Jupyter web applications like Jupyter notebook,
JupyterLab, and Voila.

dependencies.name: py-jupyterlab
dependencies.description:
JupyterLab is the next-generation web-based user interface for Project
Jupyter.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-simpervisor
dependencies.description:
simpervisor provides the SupervisedProcess class that provides async
methods start, ready, terminate, and kill to manage it.

dependencies.name: python-venv
dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
